doc.after: In the social sciences economics is the study of human choice behavior and the methodology used to make associated investment and production decisions in particular though not limited to how those choices and decisions determine the allocation of scarce resources and their effect on production distribution and consumption The word economics is from the Greek words oikos meaning family household estate and nomos or custom law and hence literally means household management or management of the state An economist is a person using economic concepts and data in the course of employment or someone who has earned a university degree in the subject Economics undergraduate courses always cover at least the two main branches
